info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 2:19PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Pima, southwestern Cochise and northeastern Santa Cruz Counties through 300 PM MST... At 217 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms from near Sierra Vista to north of Whetstone, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Fort Huachuca, Parker Canyon Lake, Fairbank, Charleston and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 298 and 315. Route 82 between mile markers 43 and 67. Route 83 between mile markers 3 and 8. Route 90 between mile markers 294 and 326. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 332. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
